description: Stoyan Stefanov

description: Addy Osmani

name: WPOStats
description: Case studies and experiments demonstrating the impact of web performance optimization (WPO) on user experience and business metrics.

name: Google Developers Case Studies
description: Learn why and how other developers have used the web to create amazing web experiences for their users.

name: Browser Diet
description: A collaborative guide about frontend performance.

name: PageSpeed Insights Rules
description: A guide created by PageSpeed Team.

name: Best Practices for Speeding Up Your site
description: The list includes 35 best practices divided into 7 categories, created by Yahoo! Exceptional Performance team.

name: PWA Summit – A free, online, single-track conference focused on helping everyone succeed with Progressive Web Apps.
Velocity – At Velocity, web operations, performance, and DevOps professionals learn to build fast, resilient, and highly available sites and apps.

performance.now() – The performance.now() conference will return to Amsterdam! We're a single track conference with fourteen world-class speakers, covering today’s most important web performance insights.
#PerfMatters – #PerfMatters Conference is the ONLINE web performance conference by internationally renowned performance developers.
Web.dev
description: Get the web's modern capabilities on your own sites and apps with useful guidance and analysis from web.dev.

name: Confess
description: Uses PhantomJS to headlessly analyze web pages and generate manifests.

name: DebugBear
description: DebugBear is a site monitoring tool based on Lighthouse. See how your scores and metrics changed over time, with a focus on understanding what caused each change. DebugBear is a paid product with a free 30-day trial.

name: Page Speed
description: The PageSpeed family of tools is designed to help you optimize the performance of your site. PageSpeed Insights products will help you identify performance best practices that can be applied to your site, and PageSpeed optimization tools can help you automate the process.

name: Lighthouse
description: Auditing and performance metrics tool for Progressive Web Applications.

name: Screpy
description: AI-Based SEO Analysis & Monitoring Tool

name: YSlow
description: YSlow analyzes web pages and suggests ways to improve their performance based on a set of rules for high performance web pages.

name: YSlow for PhantomJS
description: YSlow for PhantomJS also introduces new output formats for automated test frameworks: TAP (Test Anything Protocol) and JUnit.

name: Grunt-WebPageTest
description: Grunt plugin for continuously measurement of WebPageTest. (Demo)

name: Grunt-yslow
description: Grunt task for testing page performance using PhantomJS, a headless WebKit browser.

name: Grunt-perfbudget
description: A Grunt.js task for enforcing a performance budget (more on performance budgets).

name: Web Tracing Framework
description: Web Tracing Framework is a set of libraries, tools, and visualizers for the tracing and investigation of complex web applications

name: Yandex.Tank
description: An extensible open source load testing tool for advanced linux users which is especially good as a part of an automated load testing suite.

name: Yellow Lab Tools
description: Online quick and easy tool that audits frontend bad practices, reveals performance issues and profiles JavaScript.

name: Pagelocity
description: A web performance optimization and analysis tool.

name: Varvy
description: Test your site to see if it follows the Google guidelines for speed.

name: Web Bloat Score Calculator
description: Compare size of a page to a compressed image of the same page

name: Speed Racer
description: Collect performance metrics for your library/application using Chrome headless.

name: Speedrank
description: Speedrank monitors the performance of your site in the background. It displays Lighthouse reports over time and delivers recommendations for improvement. Speedrank is a paid product with 14-day-trial.

name: Node-yslowjs
description: YSlow.js on Node.js is a simple Node.js wrapper for programmatically running phantomjs yslow.js.

name: PSI
description: PageSpeed Insights for Node.js - with reporting.

name: Datadog APM
description: End-to-end distributed tracing and APM at scale, correlated to all telemetry.

name: BetterUptime
description: A good website monitoring tool (bundling status page, incident notification)

name: Nodown
description: Also, a monitoring tool, but that focuses on feature testing

name: Pingdom
description: A tool to get the uptime of your website (with probes from different locations)

name: UptimeRobot
description: Another uptime monitoring tool (with a generous free plan)

name: Bundlesize
description: Keep your bundle size in check.

name: source-map-explorer
description: Analyze and debug bundle space usage through source maps.

name: Bundlephobia
description: Helps you find the performance impact of adding an npm package to your frontend bundle.

name: Webpack bundle analyzer
description: webpack plugin and CLI utility that represents bundle content as convenient interactive zoomable treemap.

name: Disc
description: Visualise the module tree of browserify project bundles and track down bloat.

name: Lasso-analyzer
description: analyze and Visualise project bundles created by Lasso.

name: Packtracker.io
description: Check your webpack bundle stats on every pull request, and track them over time.

name: Compression webpack plugin
description: Prepare compressed versions of assets to serve them with Content-Encoding.

name: BundleStats
description: Generate bundle report(bundle size, assets, modules, packages) and compare the results between different builds

name: CSS-perf
description: Completely unscientific way of testing CSS performance. Most of these tests will revolve around methodologies and techniques for determining effective CSS architecture. Put another way, I want to know what works best given a particular comparison of CSS strategies.

name: JSPerf
description: jsPerf aims to provide an easy way to create and share test cases, comparing the performance of different JavaScript snippets by running benchmarks. Temporarily out, follow this issue for updates: https://github.com/jsperf/jsperf.com/issues/537

name: Benchmark.js
description: A robust benchmarking library that works on nearly all JavaScript platforms, supports high-resolution timers, and returns statistically significant results.

name: JSlitmus
description: JSLitmus is a lightweight tool for creating ad-hoc JavaScript benchmark tests.

name: Matcha
description: Matcha allow you to design experiments that will measure the performance of your code. It is recommended that each bench focus on a specific point of impact in your application.

name: Timing.js
description: Timing.js is a small set of helpers for working with the Navigation Timing API to identify where your application is spending its time. Useful as a standalone script, DevTools Snippet or bookmarklet.

name: Stats.js
description: This class provides a simple info box that will help you monitor your code performance.

name: PerfTests
description: Performance tests of JavaScript inheritance models.

name: Memory-stats.js
description: minimal monitor for JS Heap Size via performance memory.

name: PHPench
description: PHPench creates a graphical output for a PHP benchmark. Plot the runtime of any function in realtime with GnuPlot and create an image out of the result.

name: php-bench
description: Benchmark and profile PHP code blocks whilst measuring the performance footprint.

name: Yahoo YSlow for Mobile/Bookmarklet
description: YSlow analyzes web pages and suggests ways to improve their performance based on a set of rules for high performance web pages.

name: PerfMap
description: A bookmarklet to create a frontend performance heatmap of resources loaded in the browser using the Resource Timing API.

name: DOM Monster
description: A cross-platform, cross-browser bookmarklet that will analyze the DOM & other features of the page you're on, and give you its bill of health.

name: CSS Stress
description: CSS Stress is a Testing and Performance Profiling.

name: Performance-Bookmarklet
description: Analyze the current page through the Resource Timing API, Navigation Timing API and User-Timing - Sort of a light live WebPageTest. As Chrome Extension and Firefox Add-on under the name Performance-Analyser.

name: Cloudflare CDN
description: A content delivery network that uses next-gen tech to deliver a fast, reliable, CDN services

name: PageCDN
description: A state of the art opensource CDN with aggressive content optimization using brotli-11 compression, HTTP/2 server push, better HTTP/2 multiplexing, and more. Supports 100s of libraries and 2000+ WordPress themes already. Easy to use, easy to link and very fast.

name: jsDelivr
description: Similar to Google Hosted Libraries, jsDelivr is an open source CDN that allows developers to host their own projects and anyone to link to our hosted files on their sites.

name: Google Hosted Libraries
description: Google Hosted Libraries is a content distribution network for the most popular, open-source JavaScript libraries.

name: CDNjs
description: An open source CDN for JavaScript and CSS sponsored by CloudFlare that hosts everything from jQuery and Modernizr to Bootstrap.

name: Amazon CloudFront
description: A content delivery network by Amazon that integrates nicely with other Amazon services or can be used standalone.

name: jQuery
description: jQuery CDN – Latest Stable Versions, powered by MaxCDN.

name: CDNperf
description: finds you fast and reliable JavaScript CDNs that make your sites snappy and happy.

name: Gulp-google-cdn
description: Replaces script references with Google CDN ones.

name: Browser Calories
description: The easiest way to measure your performance budget.

name: Grunt-smushit
description: Grunt plugin to remove unnecessary bytes of PNG and JPG using Yahoo Smushit.

name: Gulp-smushit
description: Gulp plugin to optimize PNG and JPG using Yahoo Smushit. Made on top of smosh.

name: Smush it
description: Smush it uses optimization techniques specific to image format to remove unnecessary bytes from image files. It is a "lossless" tool, which means it optimizes the images without changing their look or visual quality.

name: Imagemin
description: Minify images seamlessly with Node.js.

name: Sharp
description: The typical use case for this high speed Node.js module is to convert large images of many formats to smaller, web-friendly JPEG, PNG and WebP images of varying dimensions.

name: Gm
description: GraphicsMagick and ImageMagick for Node.js.

name: Exexif
description: Pure elixir library to extract tiff and exif metadata from JPEG files.

name: ExifCleaner
description: GUI app to remove exif metadata from images and video files with drag and drop. Free and open source.

name: OptiPNG
description: OptiPNG is a PNG optimizer that recompresses image files to a smaller size, without losing any information.

name: Grunt-contrib-imagemin
description: Minify PNG and JPEG images for Grunt.

name: Gulp-imagemin
description: Minify PNG, JPEG, GIF and SVG images with imagemin for Gulp.

name: Grunt-WebP
description: Convert your images to WebP format.

name: Gulp-WebP
description: Convert images to WebP for Gulp.

name: Imageoptim
description: Free app that makes images take up less disk space and load faster, without sacrificing quality. It optimizes compression parameters, removes junk metadata and unnecessary color profiles.

name: Grunt-imageoptim
description: Make ImageOptim, ImageAlpha and JPEGmini part of your automated build process.

name: ImageOptim-CLI
description: Automates ImageOptim, ImageAlpha, and JPEGmini for Mac to make batch optimization of images part of your automated build process.

name: Tapnesh-CLI
description: Tapnesh is a CLI tool that will optimize all your images in parallel easily and efficiently!

name: Tinypng
description: Advanced lossy compression for PNG images that preserves full alpha transparency.

name: Kraken Web-interface
description: Optimize your images and will be available for download for 12 hours.

name: Compressor
description: Online image compressor for JPG, PNG, SVG and GIF.

name: Shrinkray
description: One-click optimization for images in your GitHub repos

name: mozjpeg
description: Improved JPEG encoder.

name: Jpegoptim
description: Utility to optimize/compress JPEG files.

name: ZopfliPNG
description: A command-line program to optimize PNG images.

name: AdvPNG
description: Recompress PNG files to get the smallest possible size.

name: Leanify
description: Lightweight lossless file minifier/optimizer.

name: Trimage
description: A cross-platform tool for losslessly optimizing PNG and JPG files.

name: ImageEngine
description: Cloud service for optimizing, resizing and caching images on the fly with great mobile support.

name: ImageKit.io
description: Intelligent real-time image optimizations, image transformations with a global delivery network and storage.

name: Optimizt
description: CLI image optimization tool. It can compress PNG, JPEG, GIF and SVG lossy and lossless and create WebP versions for raster images.

name: lazyload
description: Lazyload images, iframes, widgets with a standalone JavaScript lazyloader ~1kb

name: lozad.js
description: Highly performant, light ~0.9kb and configurable lazy loader in pure JS with no dependencies for responsive images, iframes and more

name: HeadJS- The only script in your HEAD. for Responsive Design, Feature Detections, and Resource Loading.
RequireJS
description: RequireJS is a JavaScript file and module loader. It is optimized for in-browser use, but it can be used in other JavaScript environments, like Rhino and Node.js.

name: Labjs
description: is an open-source (MIT license) project supported by Getify Solutions. The core purpose of LABjs is to be an all-purpose, on-demand JavaScript loader, capable of loading any JavaScript resource, from any location, into any page, at any time.

name: Defer.js
description: Async Everything: Make the meat of your pages load faster with this JS morsel.

name: InstantClick
description: InstantClick makes following links in your site instant.

name: JIT
description: A JIT (Just In Time) plugin loader for Grunt. Load time of Grunt does not slow down even if there are many plugins.

name: Phantomas
description: PhantomJS-based web performance metrics collector and monitoring tool.

name: Showslow
description: open source tool that helps monitor various site performance metrics over time. It captures the results of YSlow, Page Speed Insights, WebPageTest and dynaTrace Ajax Edition.

name: Bench
description: Using Phantomas (a PhantomJS backed client performance metrics scrapper). Benchmark a page, store results in MongoDB and display result via the built-in server.

name: Keepfast
description: Tool to monitor indicators related to performance of a web page.

name: GTmetrix
description: GTmetrix uses Google Page Speed and Yahoo! YSlow to grade your site's performance and provides actionable recommendations to fix these issues.

name: Pingbreak.com
description: Free site and SSL Monitoring with response time alerting (on Slack, Twitter, Mattermost, Discord or custom Webhook).

name: Pingdom site Speed Test
description: Test the load time of that page, analyze it and find bottlenecks.

name: Dotcom-tools
description: analyze your website's speed in real browsers from 20 locations worldwide.

name: WebPageTest
description: Run a free site speed test from multiple locations around the globe using real browsers (IE and Chrome) and at real consumer connection speeds. You can run simple tests or perform advanced testing including multi-step transactions, video capture, content blocking and much more. Your results will provide rich diagnostic information including resource loading waterfall charts, Page Speed optimization checks and suggestions for improvements.

name: Sitespeed.io
description: Sitespeed.io is an open source tool that will check your site against web performance best practice rules and use the Navigation Timing API to collect metrics. It will create XML & HTML output of the result.

name: Grunt-phantomas
description: Grunt plugin wrapping phantomas to measure frontend performance.

name: Perfjankie
description: Runtime Browser Performance regression suite (Demo).

name: BrowserView Monitoring
description: Continually checks web page load times in Internet Explorer, Chrome and Firefox from multiple points around the world.

name: New Relic Browser Monitoring
description: Monitor your browser-side applications in real time, with a focus on real end users’ experiences.

name: DareBoost
description: Real Browser Monitoring. Offers complete reports about web performance and quality using YSlow, Page Speed and numerous custom tips.

name: Bytes Matter Real User Monitoring
description: Full featured Real User Monitoring solution. Free tier for smaller sites. Includes monitoring for Google's Core Web Vitals.

name: WebPageTest API Wrapper for Node.js
description: WebPageTest API Wrapper is an npm package that wraps WebPageTest API for Node.js as a module and a command-line tool.

name: HTMLCompressor
description: HtmlCompressor is a small, fast and very easy to use Java library that minifies given HTML or XML source by removing extra whitespaces, comments and other unneeded characters without breaking the content structure. As a result page become smaller in size and load faster. A command-line version of the compressor is also available.

name: Django-htmlmin
description: django-html in an HTML minifier for Python with full support for HTML 5. It supports Django, Flask and any other Python web framework. It also provides a command-line tool that can be used for static sites or deployment scripts.

name: HTMLMinifier
description: HTMLMinifier is a highly configurable, well-tested, Javascript-based HTML minifier, with lint-like capabilities.

name: Grunt-contrib-htmlmin
description: A grunt plugin to minify HTML that uses HTMLMinifier.

name: Gulp-htmlmin
description: A gulp plugin to minify HTML that uses HTMLMinifier.

name: Grunt-htmlcompressor
description: Grunt plugin for HTML compression, using htmlcompressor.

name: HTML_minifier
description: Ruby wrapper for kangax html-minifier.

name: HTML_press
description: Ruby gem for compressing html, that removes all whitespace junk, and leaves only HTML.

name: Koa HTML Minifier
description: Middleware that minifies your HTML responses using html-minifier. It uses html-minifier's default options which are all turned off by default, so you have to set the options otherwise it's not going to do anything.

name: HTML Minifier Online
description: A HTML min tool by kangax (HTMLMinifier Creator).

name: Minimize
description: Minimize is a HTML minifier based on the node-htmlparser,currently, HTML minifier is only usable server-side. Client-side minification will be added in a future release.

name: Html-minifier
description: A simple Windows command-line tool to minify your HTML, Razor views & Web Forms views

name: YUI Compressor
description: JavaScript compressor which, in addition to removing comments and white-spaces, obfuscates local variables using the smallest possible variable name. This obfuscation is safe, even when using constructs such as 'eval' or 'with' (although the compression is not optimal is those cases) Compared to jsmin, the average savings is around 20%.

name: UglifyJS2
description: UglifyJS is a JavaScript parser, minifier, compressor or beautifier toolkit, written in JavaScript.

name: CSSO
description: CSS minimizer unlike others. In addition to usual minification techniques it can perform structural optimization of CSS files, resulting in smaller file size compared to other minifiers.

name: CSSmin.js
description: cssmin.js is a JavaScript port of YUICompressor's CSS minifier.

name: Grunt-contrib-concat
description: A Grunt plugin to concatenate files.

name: Grunt-contrib-uglify
description: A Grunt plugin to concatenate and minify JavaScript files.

name: Clean-css
description: A fast, efficient, and well tested CSS minifier for node.js.

name: Django-compressor
description: Compresses linked and inline JavaScript or CSS into a single cached file.

name: Django-pipeline
description: Pipeline is an asset packaging library for Django, providing both CSS and JavaScript concatenation and compression, built-in JavaScript template support, and optional data-URI image and font embedding.

name: JShrink
description: JShrink is a PHP class that minifies JavaScript so that it can be delivered to the client quicker.

name: JSCompress
description: The most minimalistic online JS Compress tool.

name: CSSshrink
description: Because CSS is ospon the critical path to rendering pages. It must be small! Or else!

name: Grunt-cssshrink
description: This is just a grunt wrapper for CSS Shrink.

name: Gulp-cssshrink
description: Shrinks CSS files using cssshrink for Gulp.

name: Prettyugly
description: Uglify (strip spaces) or prettify (add consistent spaces) CSS code.

name: Grunt-contrib-cssmin
description: CSS Minifier for Grunt.

name: Grunt-uncss
description: A grunt task for removing unused CSS from your projects.

name: Gulp-uncss
description: A gulp task for removing unused CSS from your projects.

name: Socialite.js
description: Socialite provides a very easy way to implement and activate a plethora of social sharing buttons — any time you wish. On document load, on article hover, on any event.

name: uCSS
description: uCSS is made for crawling (large) sites to find unused CSS selectors, but not remove unused CSS.

name: HTTPinvoke- A no-dependencies HTTP client library for browsers and Node.js with a promise-based or Node.js-style callback-based API to progress events, text and binary file upload and download, partial response body, request and response headers, status code.
Critical
description: Extract & Inline Critical-path CSS in HTML pages (alpha).

name: Csscolormin
description: Utility that minifies CSS colors, example: min("white"); // minifies to "#fff".

name: Lazysizes
description: High performance lazy loader for images (responsive and normal), iframes and scripts, that detects any visibility changes triggered through user interaction, CSS or JavaScript without configuration.

name: Perf-Tooling
description: Perf Tooling is a shared resource to keep track of new and existent performance tools.

name: TMI
description: TMI (Too Many Images) - discover your image weight on the web.

name: AtBuild
description: JavaScript code generation tool that lets you write JavaScript that outputs JavaScript. Good for unrolling loops and writing libraries that compile away the runtime

name: Glue
description: Glue is a simple command-line tool to generate sprites:

name: Pitomba-spriter
description: Spriter is a simple and flexible dynamic sprite generator for CSS, using Python. It can process CSS both synchronous and asynchronous as it provides classes to be used in your python code and also a watcher that listens to your filesystem and changes CSS and sprite as soon as a static is changed.

name: Grunt-spritesmith
description: Grunt task for converting a set of images into a spritesheet and corresponding CSS variables.

name: Grunt-sprite-css-replace
description: Grunt task that generates a sprite from images referenced in a style sheet and then updates the references with the new sprite image and positions.

name: Grunt-svg-sprite
description: SVG sprites & stacks galore — Grunt plugin wrapping around svg-sprite that reads in a bunch of SVG files, optimizes them and creates SVG sprites and CSS resources in various flavours.

name: Gulp-sprite
description: gulp task for creating an image sprite and the corresponding style sheets for Gulp.

name: Gulp-svg-sprites
description: gulp task for creating svg sprites.

name: SvgToCSS
description: Optimizes and renders SVG files in CSS / Sass sprites.

name: Assetgraph-sprite
description: Assetgraph transform for auto generating sprites based on the CSS dependency graph.

name: Sprite Cow
description: Sprite Cow helps you get the background-position, width and height of sprites within a spritesheet as a nice bit of copyable CSS.

name: ZeroSprites
description: ZeroSprites is a CSS sprites generator aimed at area minimization using algorithms used in the field of VLSI floorplanning.

name: CSS Sprite Generator
description: CSS sprites allow you to combine multiple images into a single file.

name: Sprity
description: A modular image sprite generator with a lot of features: supports retina sprites, supports different output formats, generates sprites and proper style files out of a directory of images, etc...

name: Sprite Factory
description: The sprite factory is a ruby library that can be used to generate CSS sprites. It combines individual image files from a directory into a single unified sprite image and creates an appropriate CSS style sheet for use in your web application.

name: SVGO
description: SVGO is a Nodejs-based tool for optimizing SVG vector graphics files.

name: SVG OMG
description: SVGOMG is SVGO's Missing GUI, aiming to expose the majority, if not all the configuration options of SVGO.

name: Grunt-svgmin
description: Minify SVG using SVGO for Grunt.

name: Gulp-svgmin
description: Minify SVG with SVGO for Gulp.

name: Scour
description: Scour is an open-source Python script that aggressively cleans SVG files, removing a lot of 'cruft' that certain tools or authors embed into their documents.

name: SVG Cleaner
description: SVG Cleaner could help you to clean up your SVG files from unnecessary data. It has a lot of options for cleanup and optimization, works in batch mode, provides threaded processing on the multicore processors.

name: Polymer Bundler
description: Polymer-bundler is a library for packaging project assets for production to minimize network round-trips.

name: Gulp-vulcanize
description: Concatenate a set of Web Components into one file that use Vulcanize.

name: HTTPerf
description: httperf is a tool for measuring web server performance. It provides a flexible facility for generating various HTTP workloads and for measuring server performance.

name: Apache JMeter
description: Open source load testing tool: It is a Java platform application.

name: Locust
description: An open source load testing tool. Define user behaviour with Python code, and swarm your system with millions of simultaneous users.

name: Autoperf
description: Autoperf is a ruby driver for httperf, designed to help you automate load and performance testing of any web application - for a single end point, or through log replay.

name: HTTPerf.rb
description: Simple Ruby interface for httperf, written in Ruby.

name: PHP-httperf
description: PHP Port of HTTPerf.rb.

name: HTTPerf.js
description: JS Port of HTTPerf.rb.

name: HTTPerf.py
description: Python Port of HTTPerf.rb.

name: Gohttperf
description: Go Port of HTTPerf.rb.

name: wrk
description: A HTTP benchmarking tool (with optional Lua scripting for request generation, response

name: beeswithmachineguns
description: A utility for arming (creating) many bees (micro EC2 instances) to attack (load test) targets (web applications).

name: k6
description: An open source load testing tool built for developers. Easy to integrate into CI pipelines. Tests are written in ES6 JS and you can test APIs, microservices and sites using HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2 and WebSocket.

name: PageSpeed Module
description: PageSpeed speeds up your site and reduces page load time. This open-source web server module automatically applies web performance best practices to pages and associated assets (CSS, JavaScript, images) without requiring that you modify your existing content or workflow. PageSpeed is available as a module for Apache 2.x and Nginx 1.x.

name: WebP-detect
description: WebP with Accept negotiation.

name: Web Performance Working Group
description: The mission of the Web Performance Working Group, part of the Rich Web Client Activity, is to provide methods to measure aspects of application performance of user agent features and APIs.

name: Page Visibility
description: This specification defines a means for site developers to programmatically determine the current visibility state of the page in order to develop power and CPU efficient web applications.

name: Navigation Timing
description: This specification defines a unified interface to store and retrieve high resolution performance metric data related to the navigation of a document.

name: Resource Timing
description: This specification defines an interface for web applications to access the complete timing information for resources in a document.

name: User Timing
description: This specification defines an interface to help web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.

name: Performance Timeline
description: This specification defines a unified interface to store and retrieve performance metric data. This specification does not cover individual performance metric interfaces.

name: CSS will-change
description: This specification defines the will-change CSS property which allows an author to declare ahead-of-time what properties are likely to change in the future, so the UA can set up the appropriate optimizations some time before they’re needed. This way, when the actual change happens, the page updates in a snappy manner.

name: Resource Hints
description: This specification defines the dns-prefetch, preconnect, prefetch, and prerender relationships of the HTML Link Element (<link>). These primitives enable the developer, and the server generating or delivering the resources, to assist the user agent in the decision process of which origins it should connect to, and which resources it should fetch and preprocess to improve page performance.

name: HTTP Archive
description: It's a permanent repository of web performance information such as size of pages, failed requests, and technologies utilized. This performance information allows us to see trends in how the Web is built and provides a common data set from which to conduct web performance research.

name: iamakulov/awesome-webpack-perf
description: A curated list of webpack tools for web performance
